intro: Scutellaria paucifolia, commonly known as the slender skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. Scutellaria paucifolia has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in open woods and meadows, where it blooms from late spring to early summer.
